instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00687: What is 820-00687? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.PP5V_G3H: What is PP5V_G3H? PP5V_G3H is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A died when closing bottom cover
threads.message:
Hi, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A died when closing bottom cover after successful repair (hall sensor on keyboard).
First it had 20v 0a only on one side of usb-c. After replacing <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> (from ssd dead board CD3215C00 same markings) got 20v 0a on both sides of the cable.

Power rails:
8.69v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 
20.06v <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL>
8.7v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
20.06v <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL>
20.4v <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
3.31v <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
3.31v <SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL>
5.06v <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.32v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_SUS_PCH</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> & PH2 0.00v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> = 0v

What also found (before, without and after CD3215C00 replacement):
<SIGNAL>USB_EXTA_P</SIGNAL>/N - SHORTED TO GRUND

Does this means that PCH is dead? Tested with 3 different dc cables, 2 chargers, 3 cables.
Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A died when closing bottom cover
threads.message:
Can be PCH, or <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>; both connected to these lines.

<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board are waste of time, all end with dead CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A died when closing bottom cover
threads.message: without <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> the <SIGNAL>USB_EXTA_P</SIGNAL>/N was still shorted to ground. Is there any solution for data recovery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A died when closing bottom cover
threads.message:
No way for this board.
If the client didn't make backups, data is lost.
